comments.content:
I haven�t been able to find an exact match for the Gala-logo.   
But if your girlfriend isn�t a typophile you might get away with   
using [Emona](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518122612/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/emona/cond-bold-italic/charmap.html) as a sustitute.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518122612im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

The a's in Gala look a lot like Times Bold Italic:   
   
 ![gala](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518122612im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/40331.gif)   
   
All I did here was set it real tight and stretch it horizontally a bit.   
   
I suspect they started from something like this and customized it.
